article.headline: Detroit 70, Wright St 66
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Brandon Cotton scored 22 points Wednesday to lead Detroit past Wright State 70-66 for the Titans' 10th victory in 11 home games this season. DaShaun Wood, who prepped at Detroit's Crockett High, had 28 to lead the Raiders (11-11, 7-5 Horizon League), who had won three straight. The Titans (12-14, 6-7) led the entire second half but Wright State got to within four on Wood's layup with 4:24 to play. Cotton answered with a jump shot and three free throws in the next minute to give Detroit some breathing room. The shorter Titans outrebounded the Raiders 35-30 and outscored them 28-20 in the paint. Detroit went on a 12-1 run in the last six minutes of the first half to take the lead for good and was ahead 30-25 at halftime. Chuck Bailey added 13 points for the Titans while Torvoris Baker had 10 and tied his career high with 12 rebounds. Jordan Pleiman had 14 points for Wright State.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
